reasoning.step2:
I will evaluate each extracted field with the supporting evidence and estimate confidence.

1) GrandTotal.Amount = 2944.36
- Evidence: Text line shows "Endbetrag EUR 2.944,36" (German format with dot as thousands separator and comma as decimal). That matches 2944.36 EUR.
- Internal consistency: Net 2,676.69 + VAT 267.67 = 2,944.36 (sums correctly).
- Uncertainty: low — formatting interpretation (comma decimal) is straightforward.
- Confidence: Very high (~95%).

2) Invoice.Date = "29-01-2024"
- Evidence: Text shows "Wien, 29-01-2024" near signature area; also "vom: 22-01-2024" refers to order, not invoice. "Wien, 29-01-2024" is standard invoice date placement.
- Uncertainty: small — could be document issue date vs delivery date, but as extracted invoice date this is most likely.
- Confidence: High (~90%).

3) Sender.VatId = "ATU22642807"
- Evidence: Text contains "ATU22642807" in a block above payment terms; also a separate "UID-Nr.: ATU 43349701" appears later — two UIDs exist. Which is sender? The top "ATU22642807" likely belongs to the sender block near totals; "UID-Nr.: ATU 43349701" appears with company registration details and bank info (could be another entity).
- Uncertainty: moderate — ambiguity between two VAT/UID numbers present. I selected the visible standalone "ATU22642807".
- Confidence: Medium (~60%).

4) Vat.Rate = 10 (%)
- Evidence: Text shows "+ 10 % Mehrwertsteuer" next to VAT line.
- Internal consistency: matches amount calculation (2,676.69 * 0.10 = 267.669 → rounded 267.67).
- Uncertainty: low.
- Confidence: Very high (~95%).

5) Net.Amount = 2676.69
- Evidence: Text shows "Auftragssumme 2.676,69" (German format). That corresponds to net amount before VAT.
- Internal consistency: matches VAT calc and grand total.
- Uncertainty: low.
- Confidence: Very high (~95%).

6) Vat.Amount = 267.67
- Evidence: Text shows "267,67" next to VAT line.
- Internal consistency: 10% of net rounded equals 267.67, and net + VAT equals grand total.
- Uncertainty: low.
- Confidence: Very high (~95%).
